result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole E. Ferron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicole E. Ferron is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicole E. Ferron was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Nicole E. Ferron

Prior: N1142 County Road E, Redgranite, WI 54970

Case called @ 3:19 p.m. Defendant Nicole E. Ferron in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended complaint stated. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 3 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Cts 1 & 2 - Dismissed outright. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Ulrich. Statement by DE. Court orders: 4 days WC Jail - 3 days CFTS - Time served sentence, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.
Jury trial on April 14, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial on March 11, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

10:30 am case called. Defendant Nicole E. Ferron in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses motion to amend complaint filed by the State. Court questions Attorney Ulrich.  Statement by Attorney Ulrich. Statement by Attorney Anderson. Court will permit amendment of the criminal complaint and makes statement regarding amendment. Court questions Attorney Ulrich regarding procedurally where the matter stands. Defendant requests a preliminary hearing to be scheduled. Court and counsel discuss scheduling. Court will hold preliminary hearing and fina pre-trial on March 11, 2016 at 3:30 pm.
State's Motion to Impeach with Prior Convictions

Final pre-trial at 03-11-2016 03:00 pm.
Jury trial at 04-14-2016 08:00 am.

12:01 pm case called. Defendant Nicole E. Ferron in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement not reached-Attorney Ulrich requests trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 08:00 am.
from Atty Ulrich requesting a plea/sentencing hearing

Case called @ 2:47 p.m.  Defendant Nicole E. Ferron in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich. Atty Ulrigh appears telephonically. Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Ulrich was recently appointed and is requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 02:20 pm.

3:03 pm case called. Defendant Nicole E. Ferron in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion between court and defendant. Defendant referred to SPD for representation.  Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Nicole E. Ferron in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing in person.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  P/S requested and scheduled.  SPD states matter to be resolved with contested terms on Deferred SEH agreement.  Upon argument, Counsel will be asking the Court to set the terms of the Deferred SEH Agreement.  After brief further discussion, SPD states he will be moving to withdraw.  Case formally called @ 9:35 AM with Court Reporter present.  Argument by SPD:   Due to breakdown in communication, moves for withdrawal.  Subsequent counsel will be appointed.  Per Def:  Agrees with withdrawal.  States she will privately retain Kate Seifert and she requests P/S hearing be scheduled.  Court advises Def that more than likely there would be a conflict with Atty Seifert due to her representation of her husband in another matter.  Def states she will contact her following this hearing today and discuss this matter and conflict.  Court grants withdrawal of Atty Sziligayi.  P/S scheduled in conjunction with the upcoming hearing for her husband.  Def also advised of her absolute right to move forward pro se if Atty Seifert unable to represent her due to conflict.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Nicole E. Ferron in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No resolution-requests additional status be set.  Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 09:20 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Szilagyi-requests plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 11:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Nicole E. Ferron in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def states she did inquire with SPD on eligibility - will not request counsel unless matter goes forward to jury trial.  Def has not had any discussions with the State.  Def speaks to ADA on possible resolution.  SPD Szilagyi appears via telephone.  Def confirms that "Carlson" is her maiden - Def's last name is "Ferron".  SPD requests Def call his office.  He states a letter was sent to Defendant.  Def states to SPD that she is unsure if his services are needed.  SPD again requests Def call his office to arrange a meeting.  STC Adjourned - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 09:50 am.

Case called @ 1:07 p.m. Defendant Nicole E. Ferron in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Katena Roberts-Turner.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $1000 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Roberts-Turner.  NGP entered.  Court orders $1000 Sig Bond.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 09:25 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
